result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean Patrick Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

The disposition of "Other" is used to indicate several different dispositions. The Charge(s)/Sentence(s) and Court Record Events sections of the WCCA record display additional information that must be reviewed in order to determine the exact disposition of the charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-  Pay a fine of $600.
-  Court waives any non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges.
-  Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay any mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges (if not already done so) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds.
-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero).

Concurrent to the sentence imposed as to Case# 21CT00149 but consecutive to any other sentence.
- Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 6 months of confinement has been served.

superMiscConds.notes: -  Seek/Maintain full-time employment OR part-time employment and school OR full-time school.
-  Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
-  Absolute Sobriety.
-  Random urine screens.
-  Breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: -  Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock device for a period of 24 months to commence after the period of revocation has been served.
- Court order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment And Driver Safety Plan.
- COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean Patrick Hoffman

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

-  Court sets Restitution at $ 0   (zero) 

As to Count  1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  38  months, concurrent to the sentence imposed as to Case# 21CT00149 but consecutive to any other sentence  -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  14  months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  24  months.  

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 6 months of confinement has been served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  Random urine screens
-  Breathalyzers
-  Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment  OR  part-time employment and school  OR  full-time school
-  Pay a fine of $600 
-  Court waives any non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges. 

COURT ORDERS:
-  Court ordered Alcohol Assessment.  Court order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment And Driver Safety Plan forwarded to the court for Judge's signature.
-  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for  24  months.   
-  Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock device for a period of  24  months  to commence after the period of revocation has been served.
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay any mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges (if not already done so) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Sean Patrick Hoffman (appears via Zoom video) with Attorney Jade K Hall (appears in person).  Defendant Sean Patrick Hoffman in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin (appears in person).
Case with two cases from Branch 1 - # 21CT00149 and # 21CT00150

Defendant is prepared to enter a plea.

As to Count  1:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Count  2:
Pursuant to operation of law, Court orders Count  2    DISMISSED.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Clerk:  jms
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sean Patrick Hoffman (appears via Zoom video) with Attorney Jade K Hall (appears in person).  Defendant Sean Patrick Hoffman in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin (appears in person).
Arraignment held.

Original Information received and filed.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. 

Defense counsel advises Court defendant is prepared to enter a plea; discussion with the parties.
Court orders case passed to 1:30 p.m. for a plea and sentencing hearing.

Clerk:  jms
Jury Instruction - filed with plea questionnaire
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.    Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Sean Patrick Hoffman in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Sean Patrick Hoffman in custody at Prarie du chien Correctional.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sean Patrick Hoffman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Arraignment scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
